metaphor.core: The structural design of the Titanic, particularly its watertight bulkheads, serves as a metaphor for React Error Boundaries. Just as bulkheads are designed to contain flooding and prevent a single breach from sinking the entire ship, Error Boundaries are React components that catch JavaScript errors in their child component tree, log them, and display a fallback UI, preventing an error in one part of the UI from crashing the entire application.

mapping.reactConcept: A JavaScript error thrown within a component
An uncaught JavaScript error crashing the entire application (white screen of death)
The fallback UI rendered by an Error Boundary when an error occurs
Parts of the application that continue to function normally despite an isolated error

metaphor.narrativeArc: The module progresses from introducing the 'unsinkable' design of the Titanic (a component-based architecture), to demonstrating the catastrophic 'cascade' of errors when bulkheads are flawed (no Error Boundaries), then shows how 'sealing the boundary' (implementing Error Boundaries) contains the damage, compares the 'two fates' of apps with and without boundaries, and concludes with lessons for building 'resilient' architectures through strategic boundary placement.

problems: Entire application crashing due to a single component error
Poor user experience (white screen of death)
Difficulty in isolating and debugging production errors

chapters.title: The Unsinkable Design
chapters.focus: Introduces the concept of React applications as component-based 'ships' and the need for error containment.

chapters.title: The Cascade
chapters.focus: Demonstrates how uncaught errors in React components can propagate and crash the entire application.

chapters.title: Sealing the Boundary
chapters.focus: Explains and demonstrates the implementation of Error Boundaries using `getDerivedStateFromError` and `componentDidCatch` to catch and display fallback UI.

chapters.title: Two Fates, One Design
chapters.focus: Compares the outcome of an application with and without Error Boundaries, emphasizing graceful degradation.

chapters.title: The Resilient Architect
chapters.focus: Discusses best practices for strategically placing Error Boundaries to create a robust and resilient application architecture.

interactiveElements: Visualizing component structure as ship compartments
Simulating cascading errors without Error Boundaries
Demonstrating how an Error Boundary catches and isolates an error, displaying a fallback UI
Side-by-side comparison of error handling with and without boundaries
Exploring strategic placement of nested Error Boundaries
